body_html:
I replaced A by tensorflow.python.layers.core.Dense and obtained similar results.

import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.python.layers.core import Dense


def A(**kwargs):
    return Dense(units=3, **kwargs)
    

# Case 1
with tf.Graph().as_default() as graph:
    x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, (None, 3), 'x')
   
    out = x
    out = A()(out)
    out = A()(out)
    out = A()(out)
    
    tf.summary.FileWriter('/tmp/tensorboard/1', graph=graph).close()

# Case 2
with tf.Graph().as_default() as graph:
    x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, (None, 3), 'x')
   
    out = x
    out = A(name='a')(out)
    out = A(name='a_1')(out)
    out = A(name='a_2')(out)
    
    tf.summary.FileWriter('/tmp/tensorboard/2', graph=graph).close()

# Case 3
with tf.Graph().as_default() as graph:
    x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, (None, 3), 'x')
   
    out = x
    out = A(name='a_1')(out)
    out = A(name='a_2')(out)
    out = A(name='a_3')(out)
    
    tf.summary.FileWriter('/tmp/tensorboard/3', graph=graph).close()
  • Case 1

  • Case 2

  • Case 3

import tensorflow as tf

def A(**kwargs):
    return Dense(units=3, **kwargs)
    

# Case 1
with tf.Graph().as_default() as graph:
    x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, (None, 3), 'x')

    out = A()(out)
    out = A()(out)

# Case 2

    x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, (None, 3), 'x')

# Case 3
